page.title: 02Wellsmead Field,Bletchley
page.content: Three schools share our playing field,Denbigh Secondary (1964),Romans Field Special (1972) and Wellsmead Middle School (1970).The origin of our name was Well's Mead which was a nearby field shown on the 1718 map,it was probably enclosed by Thomas Wells who lived in the seventeenth century. Romans Field takes its name from the Roman pottery found there.The old parish boundary separating Fenny Stratford from Bletchley was a cart track and a hedge which ran through the middle of where our playground is now.You can tell Wellsmead used to be on farmland because of our old field hedges and the derelict farmyard next to Romans Field School.When the school opened there were still ridge and furrow marks on the field.These are now gone like the brook that flowed across the school field.
